947002111388250112.text: Calvert County real estate with waterfront access and views is not nearly as expensive as New York real estate with waterfront access and views. The towns are so quaint and everyone is so friendly. I've never been there during the holidays, but they supposedly have a great time.

947001253351116807.text: If I had the kind of money that POTUS did, I'd rather have a house on the Chesapeake Bay to read and write great books than to have a gaudy penthouse in the middle of a large city. A view of New York is nothing when compared to some of the waterfront scenery on the Chesapeake Bay

947000366679384064.text: There's almost a good 2 months after Labor Day to hit the Calvert County beaches when almost no one is there, and just take some McDonald's or fried meaty clams, and sit at a picnic table, enjoy the view, look for sharks teeth, and watch some seabirds.

946999510026346496.text: My favorite time to pick up some meaty fried clams and hit Breezy Point beach to just sit and watch the water is before and after tourist season which starts on Memorial Day and ends on Labor Day. Beaches open 1 May and close 31 October.

946998602185965568.text: Of everyplace in the region, Calvert County is still mostly a Republican stronghold in Maryland. Lots of hardworking watermen making a living off of fishing, crabbing, and giving taking folks out on the Bay to go fishing. Beaches open on 1 May and close on 31 October.

946997559796666368.text: The best meatiest fried clams that I've had were at the Chesapeake Deli just north of the town of North Beach. Lots of locals go there. It's kind of rustic, but they know how to bread and fry fresh clams and oysters. It's fun to look at the yachts with their tall sails.

946996685636587520.text: After some research, I felt kind of bad about the way I got a huge live horseshoe crab back into the bay by kicking it. They are scary-looking critters, but completely harmless.

946996325798809601.text: When it comes to military's armored vehicles, I keep wondering why no one has ever designed a transport and weaponized vehicle based on horseshoe crabs. They are almost indestructible and their shape has existed since the dinosaurs.

946995642366414848.text: You'd be amazed at the amount and type of garage that washes up from the Chesapeake Bay on its beaches. I keep wondering how some of that stuff even manages to get near a body of water. I've donated a few bone fossils to the biology department at College of Southern Maryland.

946994863077253120.text: Breezy Point is one of my favorite beaches, because I like to look for fossilized sharks teeth. One day a small garden rake washed up on the shore when I needed something to pull some driftwood apart to look for fossils. It had barnacles on it. A very fun cool day!

946994281801281537.text: Chesapeake Bay is where a lot of local seafood originates - oysters, clams, muscles, rockfish, seabass, etc. - but, you have to wonder about the safety of that seafood if you've seen the amount of pollution washing up on western shore beaches like Breezy Point and North Beach.

946993601690685440.text: Lots of folks like to fish in the Potomac, but with Blue Plains Sewage Treatment Plant being on that river, most deem the fish from it as too iffy to ingest. @POTUS has never driven by it on a hot summer day like the rest of us have. You can smell it through the vehicle vents.

946992899245342720.text: Lots of folks love seafood, but it's becoming too toxic to ingest even on a daily basis due to the amount of man-made pollution in the fresh water tributaries that feed into the oceans. Floods are a nightmare that carry toxic things in their path to where sea creatures live.

946991579310575616.text: #ClimateChange describes what is taking place - excessive unpredictable weather patterns due to too much carbon dioxide in the air, and earthquakes due too much fracking underground, and huge islands of floating plastic by humans poisoning the oceans creating "dead zones".
